bluesky 0.0.1
  • Reference

Mongolia administrative level 0-2 boundary polygons, lines and gazeteer.

Source: R/data-adm.R
adm_0_sf.Rd

Mongolia administrative level 0 (country), 1 (aimag), 2 (soum), and regional boundary polygons and lines, and administrative gazeteer.

adm_0_sf

adm_1_sf

adm_2_sf

adm_region_sf

Format

An object of class sf (inherits from tbl_df, tbl, data.frame) with 1 rows and 4 columns.

Source

UN HDX

Examples

head(adm_0_sf)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 4
#>   ADM0_EN  ADM0_MN      ADM0_PCODE geometry
#>   <chr>    <chr>        <chr>      <list>  
#> 1 Mongolia Monggol Ulus MN         <XY>    

head(adm_1_sf)
#> # A tibble: 6 x 7
#>   ADM0_EN  ADM0_MN      ADM0_PCODE REGION         ADM1_EN    ADM1_PCODE geometry
#>   <chr>    <chr>        <chr>      <chr>          <chr>      <chr>      <list>  
#> 1 Mongolia Monggol Ulus MN         Central region Darkhan-U… 45         <XY>    
#> 2 Mongolia Monggol Ulus MN         Central region Dornogovi  44         <XY>    
#> 3 Mongolia Monggol Ulus MN         Central region Dundgovi   48         <XY>    
#> 4 Mongolia Monggol Ulus MN         Central region Govisumber 42         <XY>    
#> 5 Mongolia Monggol Ulus MN         Central region Omnogovi   46         <XY>    
#> 6 Mongolia Monggol Ulus MN         Central region Selenge    43         <XY>    

head(adm_2_sf)
#> # A tibble: 6 x 11
#>   Alt_pcode ADM0_EN ADM0_MN ADM0_PCODE REGION ADM1_EN ADM1_PCODE ADM2_EN ADM2_MN
#>   <chr>     <chr>   <chr>   <chr>      <chr>  <chr>   <chr>      <chr>   <chr>  
#> 1 1107      Mongol… Monggo… MN         Centr… Omnogo… 46         Nomgon  ?????? 
#> 2 1108      Mongol… Monggo… MN         Centr… Omnogo… 46         Noyon   ????   
#> 3 1112      Mongol… Monggo… MN         Centr… Omnogo… 46         Xu'rmen ?????? 
#> 4 1110      Mongol… Monggo… MN         Centr… Omnogo… 46         Xanbogd ???????
#> 5 1115      Mongol… Monggo… MN         Centr… Omnogo… 46         Dalanz… ??????…
#> 6 0610      Mongol… Monggo… MN         Centr… Dornog… 44         Xatanb… ??????…
#> # … with 2 more variables: ADM2_PCODE <dbl>, geometry <list>

head(adm_region_sf)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>   REGION         geometry
#>   <chr>          <list>  
#> 1 Central region <XY>    
#> 2 Eastern region <XY>    
#> 3 Khangai region <XY>    
#> 4 Western region <XY>
